meanings.definition: Capable of being communicated or conveyed
meanings.sent1: The idea was expressible through simple drawings.
meanings.sent2: Her emotions were easily expressible through her smile.
meanings.sent3: It was quite expressible how excited he was for the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset was expressible in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The joy of the children playing was expressible in their laughter.

meanings.definition: Able to be shown or demonstrated
meanings.sent1: The experiment results were expressible in a graph.
meanings.sent2: His skills were expressible through his impressive performance.
meanings.sent3: The magic trick was so expressible that everyone was amazed.
meanings.sent4: Her talent was expressible like a shining star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The concept was expressible through a hands-on demonstration.

meanings.definition: Possible to articulate or convey in words
meanings.sent1: The complex theory was expressible in simple terms.
meanings.sent2: Her feelings were expressible through heartfelt letters.
meanings.sent3: The joke was so expressible that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His love for music was expressible in every note he played.
meanings.sent5: The message of the speech was expressible in powerful phrases.
